articles.headline: Obama Faults F.B.I. on Emails, Citing ‘Incomplete Information’
articles.snippet: He implied that the decision by James B. Comey to announce the discovery of new emails possibly related to the Hillary Clinton case had violated investigative norms.
articles.abstract: He implied that the decision by James B. Comey to announce the discovery of new emails possibly related to the Hillary Clinton case had violated investigative norms.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHAPEL HILL, N.C. — President Obama threw the power of the White House behind Hillary Clinton on Wednesday. He faulted how the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, handled new emails related to the investigation into Mrs. Clinton’s private server, and then shouted out to college students here in a pivotal battleground state that it was crucial that they vote because the “fate of the world is teetering.”
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin, Adam Goldman and Gardiner Harris

articles.headline: Gawker and Hulk Hogan Reach $31 Million Settlement
articles.snippet: In a privacy feud, the former wrestler had been awarded $140 million in damages and the media site was forced to sell itself.
articles.abstract: In a privacy feud, the former wrestler had been awarded $140 million in damages and the media site was forced to sell itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: In fighting a lawsuit filed by the former professional wrestler Hulk Hogan, Gawker Media lost nearly everything — the verdict, its founder, its independence — but it maintained its resolute conviction that it would win on appeal.

articles.headline: Mosul Neighbors Wake Up to a Day Without ISIS
articles.snippet: Residents of one district celebrated their liberation from the Islamic State, but Iraqi commanders acknowledged that there was still a degree of support in Mosul for the group.
articles.abstract: Residents of one district celebrated their liberation from the Islamic State, but Iraqi commanders acknowledged that there was still a degree of support in Mosul for the group.

articles.headline: Why Light Bulbs May Be the Next Hacker Target
articles.snippet: Wireless “smart” devices may be the tech wave of the future, but researchers have found flaws that let hackers spread malicious code through them.
articles.abstract: Wireless “smart” devices may be the tech wave of the future, but researchers have found flaws that let hackers spread malicious code through them.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The so-called Internet of Things, its proponents argue, offers many benefits: energy efficiency, technology so convenient it can anticipate what you want, even reduced congestion on the roads.

articles.headline: Batteries That Make Use of Solar Power, Even in the Dark
articles.snippet: Solar farms are increasingly common, but they depend on the sun. A new technology harvests that energy so it can be sold when prices are high.
articles.abstract: Solar farms are increasingly common, but they depend on the sun. A new technology harvests that energy so it can be sold when prices are high.
articles.lead_paragraph: HARTWELL, ENGLAND — A new cash crop has sprung up on Nicholas Beatty’s enchanting farm near here. Rows of gray solar panels range over about 25 acres, turning sunlight into electricity, as dog-size muntjac deer hop by.

articles.headline: Big Oil Slowly Adapts to a Warming World
articles.snippet: Major oil and gas companies, facing future loss of demand for their products as a result of climate change policies, search for new strategies.
articles.abstract: Major oil and gas companies, facing future loss of demand for their products as a result of climate change policies, search for new strategies.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a warming world, Big Oil doesn’t look quite so big anymore.

articles.headline: Big Question on Climate Crisis: How to Inspire Innovation
articles.snippet: The world’s governments have committed to slashing greenhouse emissions, but it is not clear the necessary technology exists yet.
articles.abstract: The world’s governments have committed to slashing greenhouse emissions, but it is not clear the necessary technology exists yet.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAMBURG, Germany — On the edge of this northern German port city, the industrial giant Siemens is testing a way to offset the erratic nature of renewable power, by storing energy in hot rocks.

articles.headline: A Rare Moment of Unity on Capitol Hill, Thanks to Trump’s Taxes
articles.snippet: Revelations that Donald J. Trump paid no federal income tax for years, or decades, have energized bipartisan efforts to overhaul the loophole-ridden tax code.
articles.abstract: Revelations that Donald J. Trump paid no federal income tax for years, or decades, have energized bipartisan efforts to overhaul the loophole-ridden tax code.
articles.lead_paragraph: There may be a silver lining in the revelation that Donald J. Trump paid no federal income tax for years or even decades: a comprehensive overhaul of the nation’s loophole-riddled revenue-gathering system.

articles.headline: A Cashless Economy in Zimbabwe? With Little Cash, There’s Little Choice
articles.snippet: Debit card machines are proliferating in churches, supermarkets and nightclubs as anxious Zimbabweans hoard American dollars or take them out of the country.
articles.abstract: Debit card machines are proliferating in churches, supermarkets and nightclubs as anxious Zimbabweans hoard American dollars or take them out of the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: HARARE, Zimbabwe — The time came for worshipers to surrender their tithes on Sunday morning. But instead of dropping bills into a collection plate, the congregants at a large Pentecostal church rose and filed toward the deacons clutching hand-held card-reading machines. With a swipe, they were done.
articles.byline: By Jeffrey Moyo and Norimitsu Onishi

articles.headline: ‘Brexit’ Will Require a Vote in Parliament, U.K. Court Rules
articles.snippet: The High Court decision on negotiations over Britain’s withdrawal from the European Union seemed likely to slow — but not halt — the process.
articles.abstract: The High Court decision on negotiations over Britain’s withdrawal from the European Union seemed likely to slow — but not halt — the process.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The British government’s plan for leaving the European Union was thrown into uncertainty on Thursday after the High Court ruled that Parliament must give its approval before the process can begin.
articles.byline: By Stephen Castle and Steven Erlanger

articles.headline: Voters Express Disgust Over U.S. Politics in New Times/CBS Poll
articles.snippet: Most voters say that their minds are made up and that late revelations about Mrs. Clinton and Donald J. Trump made no significant difference to them.
articles.abstract: Most voters say that their minds are made up and that late revelations about Mrs. Clinton and Donald J. Trump made no significant difference to them.
articles.lead_paragraph: An overwhelming majority of voters are disgusted by the state of American politics, and many harbor doubts that either major-party nominee can unite the country after a historically ugly presidential campaign, according to the final pre-election New York Times/CBS News Poll.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin, Dalia Sussman and Megan Thee-Brenan

articles.headline: How Economic Data Is Kept Politics-Free
articles.snippet: Despite what partisans may say, career civil servants who compile employment reports follow ground rules that undermine claims that the results are rigged.
articles.abstract: Despite what partisans may say, career civil servants who compile employment reports follow ground rules that undermine claims that the results are rigged.
articles.lead_paragraph: Talk about an October surprise. The post on Twitter warning of a government conspiracy to swing the presidential election in the Democrats’ favor popped up just moments after the Labor Department reported the biggest monthly decline in the unemployment rate in nine years.

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Income Isn’t Always What He Says It Is, Records Suggest
articles.snippet: Records of Mr. Trump’s tax appeals and other documents indicate that actual income from some of his businesses may be nowhere near what he has reported on financial disclosures.
articles.abstract: Records of Mr. Trump’s tax appeals and other documents indicate that actual income from some of his businesses may be nowhere near what he has reported on financial disclosures.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the financial disclosure forms that Donald J. Trump has pointed to as proof of his tremendous success, no venture looks more gold-plated than his golf resort in Doral, Fla., where he reported revenues of $50 million in 2014. That figure accounted for the biggest share of what he described as his income for the year.
